00023 tools, providing useful utility functions.

00040 ################################################################################
00041 # Primary assignment methods
00042 ################################################################################
00043 
00044 =head2 Primary assignment methods
00045 
00046 =over
00047 
00048 =item assignSetToUser($userID, $GlobalSet)
00049 
00050 Assigns the given set and all problems contained therein to the given user. If
00051 the set (or any problems in the set) are already assigned to the user, a list of
00052 failure messages is returned.
00053 
00054 =cut
00055 
00056 sub assignSetToUser {
00057     my ($self, $userID, $GlobalSet) = @_;
00058     my $setID = $GlobalSet->set_id;
00059     my $db = $self->{db};
00060     
00061     my $UserSet = $db->newUserSet;
00062     $UserSet->user_id($userID);
00063     $UserSet->set_id($setID);
00064     
00065     my @results;
00066     my $set_assigned = 0;
00067     
00068     eval { $db->addUserSet($UserSet) };
00069     if ($@) {
00070         if ($@ =~ m/user set exists/) {
00071             push @results, "set $setID is already assigned to user $userID.";
00072             $set_assigned = 1;
00073         } else {
00074             die $@;
00075         }
00076     }
00077     
00078     my @GlobalProblems = grep { defined $_ } $db->getAllGlobalProblems($setID);
00079     foreach my $GlobalProblem (@GlobalProblems) {
00080         my @result = $self->assignProblemToUser($userID, $GlobalProblem);
00081         push @results, @result if @result and not $set_assigned;
00082     }
00083     
00084     return @results;
00085 }
00086 
00087 sub assignSetVersionToUser {
00088     my ( $self, $userID, $GlobalSet ) = @_;
00089 # in:  ($self,) $userID = the userID of the user to which to assign the set,
00090 #      $GlobalSet = the global set object.
00091 # out: a new set version is assigned to the user.
00092 # note: we assume that the global set and user are well defined.  I think this
00093 #    is a safe assumption.  it would be nice to just call assignSetToUser,
00094 #    but we run into trouble doing that because of the distinction between
00095 #    the setID and the setVersionID
00096 
00097     my $setID = $GlobalSet->set_id;
00098     my $db = $self->{db};
00099 
00100 # figure out what version we're on, reset setID, get a new user set
00101 # FIXME: old version; new call follows
00102 #    my $setVersionNum = $db->getUserSetVersionNumber( $userID, $setID );
00103     my @allVersionIDs = $db->listSetVersions( $userID, $setID );
00104     my $setVersionNum = ( @allVersionIDs ) ? $allVersionIDs[-1] : 0;
00105     $setVersionNum++;
00106     my $userSet = $db->newSetVersion;
00107     $userSet->user_id( $userID );
00108     $userSet->set_id( $setID );
00109     $userSet->version_id( $setVersionNum );
00110 
00111     my @results = ();
00112     my $set_assigned = 0;
00113 
00114 # add the set to the database
00115     eval { $db->addSetVersion( $userSet ) };
00116     if ( $@ ) {
00117     if ( $@ =~ m/user set exists/ ) {
00118         push( @results, "set $setID,v$setVersionNum is already assigned" .
00119           "to user $userID" );
00120         $set_assigned = 1;
00121     } else {
00122         die $@;
00123     }
00124     }
00125 
00126 # populate set with problems
00127     my @GlobalProblems = grep { defined $_ } $db->getAllGlobalProblems($setID);
00128 
00129 # keep track of problems assigned from groups so that we can have multiple
00130 #    problems from a given group, without duplicates
00131     my %groupProblems = ();
00132 
00133     foreach my $GlobalProblem ( @GlobalProblems ) {
00134     $GlobalProblem->set_id( $setID );
00135 # this is getting called from within ContentGenerator, so that $self
00136 #    isn't an Instructor object---therefore, calling $self->assign... 
00137 #    doesn't work.  the following is an ugly workaround that works b/c
00138 #    both Instructor and ContentGenerator objects have $self->{db}
00139 # FIXME  it would be nice to have a better solution to this
00140     my @result = 
00141         assignProblemToUserSetVersion( $self, $userID, $userSet,
00142                                $GlobalProblem, \%groupProblems );
00143     push( @results, @result ) if ( @result && not $set_assigned );
00144     }
00145 
00146     return @results;
00147 }
00148

00150 =item unassignSetFromUser($userID, $setID, $problemID)
00151 
00152 Unassigns the given set and all problems therein from the given user.
00153 
00154 =cut
00155 
00156 sub unassignSetFromUser {
00157     my ($self, $userID, $setID) = @_;
00158     my $db = $self->{db};
00159     
00160     $db->deleteUserSet($userID, $setID);
00161 }
00162 
00163 =item assignProblemToUser($userID, $GlobalProblem, $seed)
00164 
00165 Assigns the given problem to the given user. If the problem is already assigned
00166 to the user, an error string is returned. If $seed is defined, the UserProblem
00167 will be given that seed.
00168 
00169 =cut
00170 
00171 sub assignProblemToUser {
00172     my ($self, $userID, $GlobalProblem, $seed) = @_;
00173     my $db = $self->{db};
00174     
00175     my $UserProblem = $db->newUserProblem;
00176     $UserProblem->user_id($userID);
00177     $UserProblem->set_id($GlobalProblem->set_id);
00178     $UserProblem->problem_id($GlobalProblem->problem_id);
00179     initializeUserProblem($UserProblem, $seed);
00180     
00181     eval { $db->addUserProblem($UserProblem) };
00182     if ($@) {
00183         if ($@ =~ m/user problem exists/) {
00184             return "problem " . $GlobalProblem->problem_id
00185                 . " in set " . $GlobalProblem->set_id
00186                 . " is already assigned to user $userID.";
00187         } else {
00188             die $@;
00189         }
00190     }
00191     
00192     return ();
00193 }
00194 
00195 # $seed is optional -- if set, the UserProblem will be given that seed
00196 sub assignProblemToUserSetVersion {
00197     my ($self, $userID, $userSet, $GlobalProblem, $groupProbRef, $seed) = @_;
00198     my $db = $self->{db};
00199     
00200 # conditional to allow selection of problems from a group of problems, 
00201 # defined in a set.  
00202 
00203     # problem groups are indicated by source files "group:problemGroupName"
00204     if ( $GlobalProblem->source_file() =~ /^group:(.+)$/ ) {
00205         my $problemGroupName = $1;  
00206 
00207     # get list of problems in group
00208         my @problemList = $db->listGlobalProblems($problemGroupName);
00209         # sanity check: if the group set hasn't been defined or doesn't
00210         # actually contain problems (oops), then we can't very well assign 
00211         # this problem to the user.  we could go on and assign all other 
00212         # problems, but that results in a partial set.  so we die here if 
00213         # this happens.  philosophically we're requiring that the instructor
00214         # set up the sets correctly or have to deal with the carnage after-
00215         # wards.  I'm not sure that this is the best long-term solution.
00216         # FIXME: this means that we may have created a set version that
00217         # doesn't have any problems.  this is bad.  but it's hard to see 
00218         # where else to deal with it---fixing the problem requires checking
00219         # at the set version-creation level that all the problems in the 
00220         # set are well defined.  FIXME
00221         die("Error in set version creation: no problems are available " .
00222         "in problem group $problemGroupName.  Set " . 
00223         $userSet->set_id . " has been created for $userID, but " .
00224         "does not contain the right problems.\n") if (! @problemList);
00225 
00226         my $nProb = @problemList;
00227         my $whichProblem = int(rand($nProb));
00228 
00229     # we allow selection of multiple problems from a group, but want them to
00230     #   be different.  there's probably a better way to do this
00231         if ( defined( $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} ) &&
00232          $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} =~ /\b$whichProblem\b/ ) {
00233         my $nAvail = $nProb - 
00234             ( $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} =~ tr/,// ) - 1;
00235 
00236         die("Too many problems selected from group.") if ( ! $nAvail );
00237 
00238         $whichProblem = int(rand($nProb));
00239         while ( $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} =~ /\b$whichProblem\b/ ) {
00240             $whichProblem = ( $whichProblem + 1 )%$nProb;
00241         }
00242         }
00243         if ( defined( $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} ) ) {
00244         $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} .= ",$whichProblem";
00245         } else {
00246         $groupProbRef->{$problemGroupName} = "$whichProblem";
00247         }
00248 
00249         my $prob = $db->getGlobalProblem($problemGroupName,
00250                          $problemList[$whichProblem]);
00251         $GlobalProblem->source_file($prob->source_file());
00252     }
00253     
00254 # all set; do problem assignment
00255     my $UserProblem = $db->newProblemVersion;
00256     $UserProblem->user_id($userID);
00257     $UserProblem->set_id($userSet->set_id);
00258     $UserProblem->version_id($userSet->version_id);
00259     $UserProblem->problem_id($GlobalProblem->problem_id);
00260     $UserProblem->source_file($GlobalProblem->source_file);
00261     initializeUserProblem($UserProblem, $seed);
00262     
00263     eval { $db->addProblemVersion($UserProblem) };
00264     if ($@) {
00265         if ($@ =~ m/user problem exists/) {
00266             return "problem " . $GlobalProblem->problem_id
00267                 . " in set " . $GlobalProblem->set_id
00268                 . " is already assigned to user $userID.";
00269         } else {
00270             die $@;
00271         }
00272     }
00273 
00274     return();
00275 }
00276 
00277 =item unassignProblemFromUser($userID, $setID, $problemID)
00278 
00279 Unassigns the given problem from the given user.
00280 
00281 =cut
00282 
00283 sub unassignProblemFromUser {
00284     my ($self, $userID, $setID, $problemID) = @_;
00285     my $db = $self->{db};
00286     
00287     $db->deleteUserProblem($userID, $setID, $problemID);
00288 }
00289 
00290 =back

00294 ################################################################################
00295 # Secondary set assignment methods
00296 ################################################################################
00297 
00298 =head2 Secondary assignment methods
00299 
00300 =over
00301 
00302 =item assignSetToAllUsers($setID)
00303 
00304 Assigns the set specified and all problems contained therein to all users in
00305 the course. This is more efficient than repeatedly calling assignSetToUser().
00306 If any assignments fail, a list of failure messages is returned.
00307 
00308 =cut
00309 
00310 sub assignSetToAllUsers {
00311     my ($self, $setID) = @_;
00312     my $db = $self->{db};
00313     my @userIDs = $db->listUsers;
00314 
00315     debug("$setID: getting user list");
00316     # DBFIXME pre-filter with WHERE clause for status abbrevs. that allow assignment (tricky...)
00317     my @userRecords = $db->getUsers(@userIDs);
00318     debug("$setID: (done with that)");
00319     
00320     debug("$setID: getting problem list");
00321     my @GlobalProblems = grep { defined $_ } $db->getAllGlobalProblems($setID);
00322     debug("$setID: (done with that)");
00323     
00324     my @results;
00325     
00326     foreach my $User (@userRecords) {
00327         next unless $self->r->ce->status_abbrev_has_behavior($User->status, "include_in_assignment");
00328         my $UserSet = $db->newUserSet;
00329         my $userID = $User->user_id;
00330         $UserSet->user_id($userID);
00331         $UserSet->set_id($setID);
00332         debug("$setID: adding UserSet for $userID");
00333         eval { $db->addUserSet($UserSet) };
00334         if ($@) {
00335             next if $@ =~ m/user set exists/;
00336             die $@;
00337         }
00338         debug("$setID: (done with that)");
00339         
00340         debug("$setID: adding UserProblems for $userID");
00341         foreach my $GlobalProblem (@GlobalProblems) {
00342             my @result = $self->assignProblemToUser($userID, $GlobalProblem);
00343             push @results, @result if @result;
00344         }
00345         debug("$setID: (done with that)");
00346     }
00347     
00348     return @results;
00349 }
00350 
00351 =item unassignSetFromAllUsers($setID)
00352 
00353 Unassigns the specified sets and all problems contained therein from all users.
00354 
00355 =cut
00356 
00357 sub unassignSetFromAllUsers {
00358     my ($self, $setID) = @_;
00359     my $db = $self->{db};
00360     
00361     my @userIDs = $db->listSetUsers($setID);
00362     
00363     foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00364         $self->unassignSetFromUser($userID, $setID);
00365     }
00366 }
00367 
00368 =item assignAllSetsToUser($userID)
00369 
00370 Assigns all sets in the course and all problems contained therein to the
00371 specified user. This is more efficient than repeatedly calling
00372 assignSetToUser(). If any assignments fail, a list of failure messages is
00373 returned.
00374 
00375 =cut
00376 
00377 sub assignAllSetsToUser {
00378     my ($self, $userID) = @_;
00379     my $db = $self->{db};
00380     
00381     # assign only sets that are not already assigned
00382     #my %userSetIDs = map { $_ => 1 } $db->listUserSets($userID);
00383     #my @globalSetIDs = grep { not exists $userSetIDs{$_} } $db->listGlobalSets;
00384     #my @GlobalSets = $db->getGlobalSets(@globalSetIDs);
00385     # FIXME: i don't think we need to do the above, since asignSetToUser fails
00386     # silently if a UserSet already exists. instead we do this:
00387     # DBFIXME shouldn't need to get list of set IDs
00388     my @globalSetIDs = $db->listGlobalSets;
00389     my @GlobalSets = $db->getGlobalSets(@globalSetIDs);
00390     
00391     my @results;
00392     
00393     my $i = 0;
00394     foreach my $GlobalSet (@GlobalSets) {
00395         if (not defined $GlobalSet) {
00396             warn "record not found for global set $globalSetIDs[$i]";
00397         } else {
00398             my @result = $self->assignSetToUser($userID, $GlobalSet);
00399             push @results, @result if @result;
00400         }
00401         $i++;
00402     }
00403     
00404     return @results;
00405 }
00406 
00407 =item unassignAllSetsFromUser($userID)
00408 
00409 Unassigns all sets and all problems contained therein from the specified user.
00410 
00411 =cut
00412 
00413 sub unassignAllSetsFromUser {
00414     my ($self, $userID) = @_;
00415     my $db = $self->{db};
00416     
00417     my @setIDs = $db->listUserSets($userID);
00418     
00419     foreach my $setID (@setIDs) {
00420         $self->unassignSetFromUser($userID, $setID);
00421     }
00422 }
00423 
00424 =back

00428 ################################################################################
00429 # Utility assignment methods
00430 ################################################################################
00431 
00432 =head2 Utility assignment methods
00433 
00434 =over
00435 
00436 =item assignSetsToUsers($setIDsRef, $userIDsRef)
00437 
00438 Assign each of the given sets to each of the given users. If any assignments
00439 fail, a list of failure messages is returned.
00440 
00441 =cut
00442 
00443 sub assignSetsToUsers {
00444     my ($self, $setIDsRef, $userIDsRef) = @_;
00445     my $db = $self->{db};
00446     
00447     my @setIDs = @$setIDsRef;
00448     my @userIDs = @$userIDsRef;
00449     my @GlobalSets = $db->getGlobalSets(@setIDs);
00450     
00451     my @results;
00452     
00453     foreach my $GlobalSet (@GlobalSets) {
00454         foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00455             my @result = $self->assignSetToUser($userID, $GlobalSet);
00456             push @results, @result if @result;
00457         }
00458     }
00459     
00460     return @results;
00461 }
00462 
00463 =item unassignSetsFromUsers($setIDsRef, $userIDsRef)
00464 
00465 Unassign each of the given sets from each of the given users.
00466 
00467 =cut
00468 
00469 sub unassignSetsFromUsers {
00470     my ($self, $setIDsRef, $userIDsRef) = @_;
00471     my @setIDs = @$setIDsRef;
00472     my @userIDs = @$userIDsRef;
00473     
00474     foreach my $setID (@setIDs) {
00475         foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00476             $self->unassignSetFromUser($userID, $setID);
00477         }
00478     }
00479 }
00480 
00481 =item assignProblemToAllSetUsers($GlobalProblem)
00482 
00483 Assigns the problem specified to all users to whom the problem's set is
00484 assigned. If any assignments fail, a list of failure messages is returned.
00485 
00486 =cut
00487 
00488 sub assignProblemToAllSetUsers {
00489     my ($self, $GlobalProblem) = @_;
00490     my $db = $self->{db};
00491     my $setID = $GlobalProblem->set_id;
00492     my @userIDs = $db->listSetUsers($setID);
00493     
00494     my @results;
00495     
00496     foreach my $userID (@userIDs) {
00497         my @result = $self->assignProblemToUser($userID, $GlobalProblem);
00498         push @results, @result if @result;
00499     }
00500     
00501     return @results;
00502 }
00503 
00504 =back

00508 ################################################################################
00509 # Utility method for adding problems to a set
00510 ################################################################################
00511 
00512 =head2 Utility method for adding problems to a set
00513 
00514 =over
00515 
00516 =cut
00517 
00518 sub addProblemToSet {
00519     my ($self, %args) = @_;
00520     my $db = $self->r->db;
00521     my $value_default = $self->{ce}->{problemDefaults}->{value};
00522     my $max_attempts_default = $self->{ce}->{problemDefaults}->{max_attempts};  
00523     
00524 
00525     die "addProblemToSet called without specifying the set name." if $args{setName} eq "";
00526     my $setName = $args{setName};
00527 
00528     my $sourceFile = $args{sourceFile} or 
00529         die "addProblemToSet called without specifying the sourceFile.";
00530 
00531     # The rest of the arguments are optional
00532     
00533 #   my $value = $args{value} || $value_default;
00534     my $value = $value_default;
00535     if (defined($args{value})){$value = $args{value};}  # 0 is a valid value for $args{value}  
00536 
00537     my $maxAttempts = $args{maxAttempts} || $max_attempts_default;
00538     my $problemID = $args{problemID};
00539 
00540     unless ($problemID) {
00541         $problemID = WeBWorK::Utils::max($db->listGlobalProblems($setName)) + 1;
00542     }
00543 
00544     my $problemRecord = $db->newGlobalProblem;
00545     $problemRecord->problem_id($problemID);
00546     $problemRecord->set_id($setName);
00547     $problemRecord->source_file($sourceFile);
00548     $problemRecord->value($value);
00549     $problemRecord->max_attempts($maxAttempts);
00550     $db->addGlobalProblem($problemRecord);
00551 
00552     return $problemRecord;
00553 }
00554 
00555 =back
00556

00569 sub hiddenEditForUserFields {
00570     my ($self, @editForUser) = @_;
00571     my $return = "";
00572     foreach my $editUser (@editForUser) {
00573         $return .= CGI::input({type=>"hidden", name=>"editForUser", value=>$editUser});
00574     }
00575     
00576     return $return;
00577 }
00578 
00579 sub userCountMessage {
00580     my ($self, $count, $numUsers) = @_;
00581     
00582     my $message;
00583     if ($count == 0) {
00584         $message = CGI::em("no students");
00585     } elsif ($count == $numUsers) {
00586         $message = "all students";
00587     } elsif ($count == 1) {
00588         $message = "1 student";
00589     } elsif ($count > $numUsers || $count < 0) {
00590         $message = CGI::em("an impossible number of users: $count out of $numUsers");
00591     } else {
00592         $message = "$count students out of $numUsers";
00593     }
00594     
00595     return $message;
00596 }
00597 
00598 sub setCountMessage {
00599     my ($self, $count, $numSets) = @_;
00600     
00601     my $message;
00602     if ($count == 0) {
00603         $message = CGI::em("no sets");
00604     } elsif ($count == $numSets) {
00605         $message = "all sets";
00606     } elsif ($count == 1) {
00607         $message = "1 set";
00608     } elsif ($count > $numSets || $count < 0) {
00609         $message = CGI::em("an impossible number of sets: $count out of $numSets");
00610     } else {
00611         $message = "$count sets";
00612     }
00613     
00614     return $message;
00615 }
00616 
00617 sub read_dir {  # read a directory
00618     my $self      = shift;
00619     my $directory = shift;
00620     my $pattern   = shift;
00621     my @files = grep /$pattern/, WeBWorK::Utils::readDirectory($directory); 
00622     return sort @files;
00623 }
00624 
00625 =back

00639 # list classlist files
00640 sub getCSVList {
00641     my ($self) = @_;
00642     my $ce = $self->{ce};
00643     my $dir = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates};
00644     return grep { not m/^\./ and m/\.lst$/ and -f "$dir/$_" } WeBWorK::Utils::readDirectory($dir);
00645 }
00646 
00647 sub getDefList {
00648     my ($self) = @_;
00649     my $ce = $self->{ce};
00650     my $dir = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates};
00651     return $self->read_dir($dir, qr/.*\.def/);
00652 }
00653 
00654 sub getScoringFileList {
00655     my ($self) = @_;
00656     my $ce = $self->{ce};
00657     my $dir = $ce->{courseDirs}->{scoring};
00658     return $self->read_dir($dir, qr/.*\.csv/);
00659 }
00660 
00661 sub getTemplateFileList {  # find all .pg files under the template tree (time consuming)
00662     my ($self) = shift;
00663     my $subDir = shift;
00664     my $ce = $self->{ce};
00665     $subDir = '' unless defined $subDir;
00666     my $dir = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates}."/$subDir";
00667     # FIXME  currently allows one to see most files in the templates directory.  
00668     # a better facility for handling auxiliary files would be nice.
00669     return $self->read_dir($dir, qr/\.pg$|.*\.html|\.png|\.gif|\.txt|\.pl/);
00670 }
00671 sub getTemplateDirList {  # find all .pg files under the template tree (time consuming)
00672     my ($self) = @_;
00673     my $ce = $self->{ce};
00674     my $dir = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates};
00675     my @list = ();
00676     my $wanted = sub { if (-d $_ ) { 
00677                             my $current = $_;
00678                             return if $current =~/CVS/;
00679                             return if -l $current;   # don't list links
00680                             my $name = $File::Find::name;
00681                             $name = " Top" if $current =/^\./; #  top directory
00682                             $name =~ s/^$dir\///;
00683                             push @list, $name
00684                        }
00685     };
00686     File::Find::find($wanted, $dir);
00687     return sort @list;
00688 }
00689 
00690 =back
00691 
00692 =cut

00694 1;
